Upgrades: This gun has the majestic arms speed strip 3.2 kit installed. As such, to disassemble the gun, all you need to do is undo the allen nut on top and pull out the bolt. If you've done your research, you know that the takedown procedure can be tricky, so this kit makes the whole process practically pain free. It also made the trigger crisper and lighter. Finally, it disengaged the magazine safety feature. The kit alone was over $60 so I think this is a fair price. Please visit the majestic arms website for more details: http://majesticarms.com/id10.html

Additional info: 3 magazines are included for this sale. 


Make: Remington 

Model: 870 Express Magnum (Customized)

Caliber: 12g

Location (city or county): Milpitas 

Price: $425

Will ship (Y/N): No

Other info: 

This shotgun started out as a standard Remington 870 Express Magnum, essentially a bird gun. Here is a list of modifications which I used to turn it into my HD shotgun: 

1) Brand new factory Remington 18.5 Rifle Police Barrel $160

2) Tacstar 6 shell side Saddle $30

3) Wilson Combat +2 magazine extension (+ follower) $60 

4) Mesa Tactical 870 AR Stock adapter: $140 

5) AR 15 standard stock (Not sure on make) $15 

6) AR-15 Limbsaver recoil pad $35 

7) Magpul MOE Grip $20 

8) Olive Drab / Black Gunkote paint job done by Valkyrie Arms ($150) 

Total cost in modifications: approximately $610.00 

Note: I figure a used Remington 870 Express Magnum goes for between $200-$300 (according to Gunbroker). So this gun cost me essentially $810 - $910 in the end. Bearing that in mind, I'm asking for $425, so please don't lowball me. I'm including the factory 26 inch ribbed barrel and stock as well. I realize this is a "tacticool" modification, so I apologize for offending any traditionalist. However, if this is your cup of tea, your saving a whole lot of money. 


Additional Info: The paint on the bottom of the foreend is wearing a bit because of the racking action (metal on metal), but it's not a huge deal. As you can see from the pics, the paint job is holding very well overall

This Mossberg Tactical 22 is in Like New Condition. Very low round count, Not a scratch on it.


Mossberg is joining industry heavyweights in the AR-15 market such as Remington, Ruger, and S&W. Mossberg wants to differentiate themselves inthe market by going with a A2-style (carry handle) receiver instead of the A3-style. Featuring A2 front and rear sights with a carry handle picatinny rail if you want to mount optics. postcontent:
Hello!  I sold my house and no longer have a need for my tool chest, at least not one as large as this.  It is a combination of the Kobalt 41 inch 11 drawer chest (on casters) and the 41 inch 9 drawer topper.  It has led a very sheltered garage only life and is in near new condition.  The only flaw is a bit of surface rust on the top lid where some water dripped on it and went unnoticed for a few days.  The casters roll fine, all welds are intact and all the drawers function flawlessly.

Take a look at the Lowes website for a better description, or just go look at the floor model they've got sitting out at the store.

I would consider trades/trades plus cash (depending on difference in values either way) for the following firearms:

AR-15 variants, prefer 16 inch BBL, free float BBL/handguard, decent receiver brand, no Franken-rifles.

Desert Eagle, any caliber.
MPA MAC clone, prefer .45 caliber, but 9mm will do fine. (no actual MACS pls)

COMPANY PROFILE

     In 1998 Joe Roebuck recognized the increasing demand for a safe, simple to use, and affordable firearm due to political climate changes and most states enacting legislation to allow conceal and carry permits. Joe Roebuck has been in the manufacturing industry for 35 years, and chooses to use his talents as a Tool & Die Maker and Mechanical Design Engineer to design the CPX series of firearms. . September 2003, Joe Roebuck founded Skyy Industries, LLC now known as Sccy Industries, LLC to produce a conceal & carry firearm known as the CPX 9mm. The company's first offices and manufacturing facility was located in South Daytona, Florida and as of February 2010 relocated to a new 21,000 sq. ft. facility located in Daytona Beach, Florida, just a half a mile from the famous Daytona 500 speedway.

     Contained in Sccy's new facility are numerous state of the art CNC machining centers of various types using custom tooling and programs designed by Joe Roebuck. The barrel, slide, receiver and all other major metal components are manufactured at the new facility. It was Joe Roebuck's vision that the CPX series firearms could be both cost effective and precisely manufactured to be as good as or even better than other name brand name products, without the high cost to the retail buyer. Sccy is now positioned to continue producing and developing new designs for the CPX series firearms. The CPX series envisioned has been successfully manufactured and sold throughout the United States using its own dealer network. Sccy's success is benchmarked by producing over 45,000 firearms to date. This success continues to grow with the current introduction of the new "Generation 2" CPX series. This year, 2011 Sccy will produce CPX‐1 and CPX‐2 "Generation 2" pistols and expand its national dealer base to a new all‐time high.

     New customer service procedures are now in place to insure fast and personal service to both retail customers and dealers in need of warranty service. We wish to thank every customer and dealer for the trust and continued loyalty to the Sccy brand and products.



Warranty
If anything ever goes wrong with any gun you buy with the Davidson's GuaranteeD® Lifetime Replacement Warranty, it will be replaced. If no replacement is available, it will be repaired at no charge to you. Simple, just return it to the GuaranteeD® retailer where you purchased it, pay for the return shipping and upon receipt Davidson's will ship you a *BRAND NEW GUN.

title: For Sale/Trade:  5.45 saiga and ammo
postcontent:
For sale or trade is an iz-240 saiga semiautomatic rifle in 5.45x39, along with 780 rounds of ammunition.  The rifle is lightly used but has been cleaned after every firing.

For those who are unfamiliar, this round is like a Russian equivalent of 223, and has a nickname of being the poison bullet due to its tumbling abilities.  The iz240 is a rifle that  often is easily converted into an ak74 (which is an ak47 in this caliber).

It takes unmodified high capacity ak74 magazines.  The feed ramp mod is not applicable to this caliber.  I have tried it and there are no issues.

Price is 550 but I will listen to offers.

title: For Sale:  LNIB CZ75 SP-01 Phantom
postcontent:
Relatively unknown in the US, the CZ75 is THE most used sidearm for law enforcement and military police in the world. It is a popular choice among competitive shooters, due to the unique slide in frame design which allows the shooter to have a higher grip relative to the bore.

I have had only 300 rounds through this gun, with zero stoppages. It has proven to be incredibly accurate. There are absolutely zero scratches or wear of any kind on the gun. title: For Sale:  German K98 mauser
postcontent:
Here is an opportunity to own a nice collector's piece. 
Original wood finish and metal, gun has not been refurbished
War Eagle markings on multiple parts of the rifle
DUV 42 marked on receiver, early serial number
Battle worn, no duffel cut, no sporterizing
Early import, only import mark is "Germany" on barrel so it doesn't have "CAI" or anything else all over it
Complete bolt serials different from complete rifle serials, very typical of a capture rifle in the war when the rifles were in one pile and the bolts were put in another. This gun is not in perfect shape, keep in mind there was a good chance this was used in battle, and as a result the stock has some scratches/dings and the metal has some wear and pitting. This rifle still functions and shoots fine, it just doesn't do any of that in the safe. 
If you are looking for a glossy, perfect stained, unused mauser this is not the one for you. You'd be better off buying one from Mitchell's Mausers that was made after the war and selling for the same price I am asking. If you want a nice collector piece at a lower price than what I have compared to on other sites, then please contact me. Understand that I am no expert, and since these aren't on a shelf at your local Bass Pro with a price tag it's hard to decide a price on something like this. You're welcome to make a cash offer, but don't be offended if I say no. Low ballers will be ignored, I am in no financial bind, and have no problem holding onto it just to sell it for more in a few years. Any questions are welcome, and I will try and answer to the best of my ability. I am in Portland, but travel to Nashville frequently and can meet anywhere in both areas. I also travel across TN from time to time for work, so if feel free to contact me even if you're a good bit away. If it hasn't sold by the time I am in your neck of the woods I can arrange to meet or something. Thanks in advance, have a good day!

title: For Sale:  Home Defense / Tactical Shooting
postcontent:
NOTE: THIS IS NOT A BEGINNER'S COURSE. *You must be able to prove you have ample shooting experience

$ Discount $: If you have attended any of our other courses, we’ll take an additional ten dollars off the price of this course.

The Personal Protection In the Home course teaches defensive / tactical shooting skills which cannot be taught on a typical "box" range. 

This intermediate level course enables experienced shooters to move to cover, shoot from behind barricades, develop and employ advanced Flash-Sight-Picture skills, and much more. 

We cover mindset, legal issues, decision-making under pressure, and planning for the worst. 

This course is designed around the use of the defensive pistol where standard marksmanship skills will not work, and will better enable you to survive a felonious attack.

Topical areas include:

1. Defensive Shooting / Rapid Engagement

2. Defensive Handgun Skills

3. Firearms and the Law: Possession, Ownership, and the Use of Deadly Force

4. Strategies for Home Safety and Responding to a Violent Confrontation

5. Selecting a Handgun for Personal Defense

6. Three hours of Range Shooting

7. Course Review and Examination

Students will receive the NRA Guide to the Basics of Personal Protection in the Home handbook and intensive lessons on basics of defensive shooting, issues of self-defense, and other strategies for protecting the home and family.

Students will receive feedback on their shooting exercises, and a National Rifle Association (NRA) certificate upon successful completion of this course. Not only are shooting standards fired during the practical exercises, but a written exam will be given at the end of the course. Throughout the course an individual checklist may be used to ensure the satisfactory absorption of the material being taught.

Our next PPITH Course is scheduled for this Saturday, September 29th, 2012. Don't wait, sign up now! 

For more information visit our website at www.PatriotTAC.com, and be sure to like us Facebook!

* Proof of shooting experience can be one of the following: NRA Basic Pistol Course Certificate, NRA FIRST Steps Course Certificate, NRA pistol competitive shooting qualification card, military DD 214 with pistol qualification, or passing the Pre-Course Assessment

title: For Sale:  FNP45, Taurus 66, KelTec P11
postcontent:
Up for dibs I have a small collection of handguns. These are all in excellent condition and great shooters, I just want to narrow down my collection a bit to my concealed carry piece and one more handgun.

I realize the FNP 45 pic isn't there. I didn't realize I only got 3 pics when I wrote this so you can view the FNP at http://www.fracturedperspective.com/guns/fnp.jpg

The price listed above is if you buy the whole collection, which will result in a $100 savings over the piecemeal purchase. Since I'm selling 4 handguns you get a discount of $25 per gun if you buy more than one in a go.

Below is the listing of guns for sale along with their solo purchase price and a quick blurb about the guns.

FN Herstal FNP 45 (45 ACP) w 3x14rnd magazines - $400
Less than 100 rounds through it. Bought it instead of a 1911 and while it's a good shooter it's just not my style. Has a Hogue Handall grip on it.

*SPOKEN FOR*Glock 17: This gun is pretty much sold already..

Taurus Model 66 (357 Mag) 7rnd revolver - $300
I kind of don't want to give this gun up but I don't shoot it. I can't stand a gun sitting in my closet unused and I know I can find it a home where it will get plenty of range time. Smooth, tight action and decent trigger pull. Just over 100 rounds down the barrel.

KelTec P11 w 2x10rnd magazine - $200
Very good pocket pistol. A little holster wear near the tip and a small scratch on the slide. Comes with a Don Hume leather RH IWB holster. Also has a Hogue Handall on it as well as the pinkie extensions on both mags. I have the flat base plates for both magazines.

I've included pictures, questions welcome. None of these guns has been used to fire reloads, only factory ammo in standard ANSI/SAAMI pressures. The shiny patches in the pictures on matte parts is oil; I store my guns in a light coat of oil to prevent oxidation and the foam tends to cause it to collect where it touches.

If you have a good MilSpec/GI 1911 you want to trade I might be interested in a trade involving either a single gun or two guns +cash.

Buy rules: 
Face to face sale - Provide a valid Texas driver's license. I won't travel very far to bring the guns to you and I will not meet anywhere but a public place like a shooting range or gun store. Period. No personal checks.

Shipped orders - I will require the guns to be shipped to an FFL so you'll need to provide me their contact number so that I can acquire a copy of their license prior to shipping. Shipping will be a flat $10 per handgun fee. Payment accepted by PayPal.

Thanks for looking!
